title: Corporate Learning – Community and Professional Education
body: Learn more about Professional Certification Programs Kennesaw State University is dedicated to helping you and your organization succeed. Using our subject-matter experts, along with our Corporate Learning team, we will design new programs that meet your business goals and objectives while leveraging our award-winning programs to help transform your business. Our programs use best practices in customization, technology-enhanced learning, and on-the-job application. Our classroom-based certificate programs, virtual-based programs, and digital badge mobile-learning programs are designed to help you reach your full potential as leaders, innovators, and change-makers. We specialize in designing hybrid programs that integrate the best practices in “ GAME-fied” online learning  with the best practices in classroom application. It’s called the  PLAY—PRACTICE—PURPOSE  approach to professional development. This innovative approach allows us to both improve and accelerate the teaching and learning process. A Corporate Academy serves a strategic function by integrating employee development as individuals, teams, and eventually as the developer of the entire organization. Corporate academies drive the educational goals of organizations that want to enhance their learning culture.  The idea is to have a classroom or virtual platform that serves as the organization’s specific and recognized training base to align employees with the organization’s business objectives. We specialize in designing hybrid, in-class or 100% online programs that integrate the best practices in “GAME-fied” online learning . Custom-designed programs will leverage its award-winning core offerings to meet your specific leadership and professional development needs. You have the option of sending a team of employees to one of our existing in-demand KSU certificate programs designed to provide side-by-side learning with professionals from other organizations and industries. Listed below are some of our most popular certification/certificate programs: Corporate Learning Partners have several options to engage with KSU to meet their business leadership and development needs.   Featured Professional Certification Programs   DESCRIPTION:  Master a skill that’s crucial in multiple industries with a qualification employers routinely seek. This hybrid course will provide you with several critical aptitudes that will enhance your expertise and expand your career options. It will help you prepare for the PMP® and CAPM® certification exams from PMI. KSU is a Project Management Institute Registered Education Provider (R.E.P.). This course satisfies the 35 hours of project management training required by the Project Management Institute for the PMP Certification. DELIVERY:  Hybrid Fee : $ 4,549 DESCRIPTION:  Companies have no greater asset than their people, and the management of functions related to human resources is absolutely critical to today’s business success. From learning the essentials to SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP certification preparation and exam review, our experienced instructors will help you develop the knowledge you need to work effectively. DELIVERY:  Classroom FEE:  $ 1,799 DESCRIPTION:  The Mini MBA program offered by the Michael J. Coles College of Business at Kennesaw State University can help you dramatically improve your business knowledge and acumen. At the end of the program, you will earn an Executive Certificate in Business Strategy credential that will help you advance in your career. DELIVERY:  Classroom FEE:  $  3,900 DESCRIPTION:  The professional selling certification process assists companies in: The key topics include: This program provides a foundation for individuals just beginning their sales career as well as new approaches for veteran salespeople. DELIVERY:  100% Online Format, or Hybrid Format—50% Online and 50% Classroom FEE:  $895 per person (Online Only) or $3,995 per person (Online and Classroom Action Learning) Kennesaw - KSU Center (470) 578-6765  © 2022 Kennesaw State University - Community and Professional Education

title: Online Courses – Community and Professional Education
body: At the College of Professional Education, we understand that face-to-face learning doesn’t always fit your schedule. That’s why we offer over 350 online courses and 65 certificate programs to help you learn the skills needed to advance your career. Earn a certificate of completion for every course, and many programs also include vouchers to earn your professional certification. We offer two online formats to fit your life and your learning style. Monthly online courses begin the middle of each month, and lessons release every Wednesday and Friday over the course of six weeks. There is no set time you need to be online to complete the lessons. Lessons include quizzes, assignments, discussion areas, and supplemental links to help you excel in your chosen topic. After passing your final exam with an 80% or higher, you will be mailed a certificate of completion. Self-Paced courses contain the same lessons as our Monthly online courses. All lessons are immediately available once enrollment verification is complete, on each Wednesday by 5 p.m. PLEASE NOTE: There is no instructor support for self-paced courses. Certificates are printed the first business day of the month for all successful completions (final exam score of 80 or higher) in the month prior. If you would like to receive more information about these programs or speak with a program lead, submit your information below: Kennesaw - KSU Center (470) 578-6765  © 2022 Kennesaw State University - Community and Professional Education

title: About - College of Science and Mathematics
body:
College of Science and Mathematics Resources For 
                        	 
                        	 Don't lose your federal financial aid due to your course choices! Talk to your advisor
                        before  planning your schedule . For more information about the College of Science and Mathematics (CSM) Office of
                     Advising, please contact the office directly: PHONE:  (470) 578-5113 EMAIL:   csmadvising@kennesaw.edu Kennesaw Campus Science Building, Building #370 Room #204, 2nd Floor Kennesaw Campus map (PDF) Marietta Campus Advising David Marsh  and  Tiffanie Ruth  are available for in-person advising meetings on the Marietta campus.  Norton Hall, Room 163 The CSM is one of the fastest growing units within Kennesaw State University (KSU)
                     with Bachelor of Science degree programs in biology, biochemistry, chemistry, computational
                     and applied mathematics, environmental science, mathematics, and physics.  Pre-professional students with interests in pre-dental, pre-med, pre-pharmacy, and
                     pre-vet are encouraged to look into options within the biology, chemistry, or biochemistry
                     majors, while students with interests in actuarial sciences or statistics are encouraged
                     to look into degree options within one of the mathematics majors. Graduates of our
                     degree programs are among the best prepared in Georgia for professional school, graduate
                     school or careers in industry as a result of our world-class faculty and the outstanding
                     research experiences available to our students. title: Home - OLLI at Community and Professional Education - Kennesaw State University
body: OSHER LIFELONG LEARNING INSTITUTE 50+ OLLI Programs Check out a complete list of our courses by category and starting date Learn the basics of painting in oil and acrylic from a qualified, award winning professional painter.    With and emphasis on design, value and color we will explore landscape, florals, still life, and more.    We will paint directly from life or Alla Prima to gain confidence and skill. The instructor will work one on one with students to address their needs, from beginning to advanced. Give a touch of elegance to your personalized invitations, posters, and greetings. Great for beginners; this course focuses on uppercase, lowercase, and basic italic lettering using the broad pen. The final class will be devoted to a display of skill where each student will create an original calligraphic design. All materials included; no extra fees. This class is designed to help students apply their creative talent in landscapes, still life, master copies, portraits, and more. Students will discover the flexibility of acrylic paint and learn how to correct mistakes. Required materials: paint, brushes, and canvas. Learn secrets your piano teacher never told you in this 3-hour session. Students will learn all the chords needed to play any song, any style, and any key. Students will then perfect their technique at home using the student manual issued during class. A cash or check payment of $29 is required for the student manual and supplies. Students will learn stitches such as peyote, herringbone, and netting. Additionally, students will be able to work with wire and learn some new bead weaving techniques. A supply fee of $70 is payable to the instructor at the first class. In this course, students will learn how the flute was originally used by the Plains Indians and how it has re-gained popularity in the music industry. Students will also be introduced to basic steps on how to play the Native American flute. Students are encouraged to bring their own flute; however, flutes will be available for purchase. The focus of this class is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to draw and paint a variety of subject matter from still life to portraits. Students will learn oil painting concepts and techniques that are relevant to every painting: composition, value, color, edges, light key, brush strokes, paint quality, shapes, massing, light/shadows, etc.       Demonstrations and critiques will be presented, however each student will be mentored and taught at their current level of experience. For oil and acrylic painters with some experience. Work on your own projects with guidance and technical assistance. The instructor will stress design, value relationships, color and emotional impact. There will also be opportunities for Alla Prima still life and Plein Air to keep your skills growing. Through a combination of Individual and group critiques you can judge the effectiveness of your work and find solutions and inspiration to move to the next level in your art. This class is designed to help advanced level students further develop their extensive skills towards more completed works of art.  You should have experience painting portraits and figures, as well as knowledge and ability in the use of composition, proportions, values, colors, and edges.  You will concentrate on capturing a likeness in fresh vibrant flesh tones in oils or pastels while working from photos or live subjects.  Mr. Varner has studied with many of today’s portrait masters and uses his experience to enhance each student’s quest for personal expression. Professional artist and instructor Ernest Varner says, “If you can sign your name and I can read it, you can learn to draw and paint portraits and figures. Now that that’s out of the way, let’s have some fun!!”   This class is designed to take the mystery out of painting portraits and figures whether you prefer classical realism or impressionism. It will concentrate on capturing a likeness in fresh vibrant flesh tones in oils or pastels while working from photos. Particular attention will be given to understanding light and shadow and how to model light and shadow, with the use of more expressive drawing, value, color, edges and brushwork techniques, to create the illusion of form.   Instructor demos, slide presentations, lectures and critiques are intended to enhance students' self expression so they can take their skills to the next level. Mr. Varner has studied with many of today’s portrait masters and brings all of those skills to the classroom to add to each student’s quest for personal expression. The Zentangle Method is a form of meditative drawing that uses repetitive patterns called “tangles” in combination with dots, lines, curves, and orbs to create beautiful pieces of abstract art.   Learning and practicing this form of art can increase the overall sense of personal wellbeing.  Students will learn up to thirty-two tangles and complete eight projects.  A recommended supply list is available. Are you planning your next travel adventure to Italy? Get a head start on the basic communication skills to get the most out of your trip!  Pronunciation, typical greetings, and travel-related dialogue will be covered in a fun learning environment. Enjoy your discovery of cultural observances, while you learn to speak simple phrases in Italian. Join us for an evening of fun, food and dancing.  *Dinner is served from 6-7 p.m. Dancing/music from 7-9 p.m. Reservations are required and can be made by calling 470-578-6765, or you can register online. The cost is $20 per person (payable at time of reservation). This secures seating for the program. Doors open at 5:45 p.m Our OLLI Sampler is a combination of course samplings that we offer each year. Courses will include a mixture of history, art, and some exciting surprises. Each Monday will bring a new set of instructors and a new adventure.        This course includes admission to five sampler classes and our fall social. Register a friend for free!  The social includes dinner, dancing, and live music for all!  Learn Basic Ballet Barre with stretching to improve strength, flexibility, and balance, all in a safe and non competitive environment. Then enjoy a low impact aerobic to improve stamina and brain power. Finally completing the class with a relaxing cool down. Enjoy the benefits of a class that leaves you feeling refreshed and relaxed, yet energized in a heightened state of awareness. This beginners class consists of gentle yoga stretching and is open to people aged 50 and over. A signed waiver is required at the start of the first class session. Ideal for seniors, joint-friendly Pilates increases strength and flexibility through gentle toning exercises and can be adjusted to suit all fitness levels. Boost your stamina and muscle tone without the risks of high impact exercise. Wear loose clothing and bring a towel or yoga mat. Students must sign a waiver prior to class. In this beginning class, learners will be shown QiGong and Tai Chi moves and postures designed to: improve balance, strengthen, and tone muscles, improve concentration, and encourage an overall sense of health and well-being. Students will also be taught QiGong breathing and relaxation techniques. This is done without high impact/strenuous activity. A signed waiver is required prior to start. This course, expanded from its precursor QiGong/Tai Chi I, will have the same beneficial breathing and exercise techniques but with more advanced skills. Learners will be taught Yang style 48 move Tai Chi as well as advanced QiGong style forms and meditation. Completion of QiGong/Tai Chi I recommended for admission.  A signed waiver is required prior to start. As pathways to better fitness, yoga and Pilates take different approaches. But what if you could combine some of the best qualities of each into a single exercise program? Yoga & Pilates - Perfectly Combined brings together the stretching of yoga and the core strengthening practices of Pilates into a challenging and fun routine appropriate for anyone interested in improving their fitness levels. In this course, the fourth in a series, students will learn about the famous and not-so-famous events and personalities of the Civil War in Georgia.  Recommend Text: Day by Day Through the Civil War in Georgia, by Michael K. Shaffer. (ISBN: 9780881468243.) Where were you when President Kennedy was shot? When Iran seized our embassy in Tehran? This course will explore events in American history during the last 70 years. We’ll look at the following topics: JFK’s presidency and assassination, including possible assassination theories; the student revolt and the counterculture of the sixties; the Vietnam War, what went right, what went wrong, and the question of could the U.S. have won; Nixon’s détente with China and Russia, the end of the Cold War, and new threats from both nations; the Iranian Revolution, the hostage crisis, and the Iranian threat today; the events leading to 9/11 & where the U.S. seems to be in the war on terror.  This course is a survey of the U.S. Constitution and is not political. Understanding the three branches of government and the amendment process is invaluable to all Americans. The perspectives and personalities of the founders will make the Constitution come alive.  The debates and compromises that resulted in the oldest standing written Constitution in the history of the world will be highlighted.  As we approach our 250th anniversary understanding the original intent will be invaluable to all Americans. The last decade of the 20th century sent a message that the future might not entirely be one of peace and prosperity. During that decade the world would experience two major political shifts, the collapse of the Soviet Union and the rise of the European Union. Germany was reunited and Nelson Mandela became the president of South Africa. There were advances in science and technology, the commercial internet and the iMac both debuted. It was also the decade of the O.J. Simpson trial, the death of Princess Diana and the Branch Davidian raid. In this class will look at these events and more, leading up to the dawn of the 21st century. AMERICA TAKES OVER - From the advisory effort to landing of the Marines, Buildup and Escalation, The War Turns North, Khe Sanh Base & Siege, Lang Vei is Overrun, Tet 1968, Bombing Halts, Peace Negotiations, Passing the Torch… The American Westward movement was the most monumental expansion in the history of the world. This class will explore the men and women who pioneered that movement.  The personalities coupled with historic events make dramatic and inspiring stories that need to be told. Students will meet personalities like Lewis & Clark, Crockett, the builders to the transcontinental railroad, Fremont, Pike and Carson as well as those who drove the herds north. The course is designed for students who have completed Part I through IV of the certificate program Spanish Is Fun!, as well as Beyond Spanish Is Fun, or who have intermediate-level skills in Spanish. The primary focus of this course will be on conversation of various topics and themes, including movies, news articles, current events, analysis of expressions. This course is designed and specifically organized for students who have completed the 4-part series of Spanish is Fun. Through this class, students will learn about segments of grammar and verb tenses within the Spanish language, as well as Spanish history, culture, and conversation. The instructor will use an online curriculum along with in-class handouts and a textbook. The course, Beginning American Sign Language (ASL I) is a prerequisite to this class. This is Part II of the course, Bridge in the 21st Century-Part I. This class can be taken as a stand-alone; no prerequisite is required; however, participants should be familiar with bidding concepts introduced in the first class. This course will focus on the play of the hand, particularly declarer play. The last decade of the 20th century sent a message that the future might not entirely be one of peace and prosperity. During that decade the world would experience two major political shifts, the collapse of the Soviet Union and the rise of the European Union. Germany was reunited and Nelson Mandela became the president of South Africa. There were advances in science and technology, the commercial internet and the iMac both debuted. It was also the decade of the O.J. Simpson trial, the death of Princess Diana and the Branch Davidian raid. In this class will look at these events and more, leading up to the dawn of the 21st century. Bonjour! Join us in this next French class as we go out to dine and shop for clothes. We will also learn vocabulary for a market visit and look at some typical recipes. Let’s visit Paris and her monuments and hidden gems. This course requires Introduction to French I as a prerequisite or at least some knowledge of the basics in French. See you soon! A bientôt!    Special notice: This class will be delivered online. You will need access to a computer with an internet connection that remains stable for the duration of the class. Though a chat feature is available, a microphone is preferred. For most productive audio/video participation, a webcam and/or headset are encouraged. All virtual classes will be recorded. Salut! In this follow-up from French I, students will learn: how to order in a restaurant, introduce themselves, and ask about contact information and identity. More useful vocabulary will be incorporated to prior French language skills. This course requires Introduction to French I as a prerequisite. This course, expanded from its precursor QiGong/Tai Chi I, will have the same beneficial breathing and exercise techniques but with more advanced skills. Learners will be taught Yang style 48 move Tai Chi as well as advanced QiGong style forms and meditation. Completion of QiGong/Tai Chi I recommended for admission.  A signed waiver is required prior to start. This course is designed to introduce students to the French language and francophone cultures. No prior knowledge of French is required. Through a fun, interactive, and communicative approach, you will be placed in real life situations allowing an acquisition of basic language skills. All four language skills (listening, writing, speaking, and reading) will be presented with a strong emphasis on listening and comprehension and oral communication. Various cultural topics will be explored to expand one’s awareness of French culture around the world. Students will learn stitches such as peyote, herringbone, and netting. Additionally, students will be able to work with wire and learn some new bead weaving techniques. A supply fee of $70 is payable to the instructor at the first class. Learn hands on bread making techniques for a variety of breads and pastries. You will learn the complete baking process including: proper kneading techniques, proofing and shaping. You will use these skills each week to create savory and sweet artisan breads like: multi-grain, focaccia, baguettes, pretzels, cinnamon rolls and more. This course covers selected components from Chapters 9-12 of Spanish Is Fun, Lively Lessons for Beginners, Book 1. Students will examine the names of various professions and practice expressing one’s and others' professions. Students will then study how to describe location and temporary conditions of people and things versus permanent traits of people and things. Students will study how to express dates, months of the year, and celebrations and events that take place during specific months. This class is open to the students who have a basic knowledge of the Italian language but they want to improve their ability to speak.  We will practice the fundamentals of the language, reviewing basic vocabulary and expressions.  Students will feel more confident when they will have to speak the language, each class will have a topic to talk about.  Don't be shy and jump into the conversation! In this course, you will be introduced to the basics of interior decorating and the psychology of color and design.  We will discuss how to find or choose your color palette, how to choose the perfect picture or art, select paint color, furniture, lighting, how to choose the best flooring for your home or business, and so much more. You will learn practical decorating concepts to implement into your home or business. You will be introduced to various Interior Design apps that help when visualizing your room or office. The class will also enjoy a hands-on field trip to DM Interiors and Design to explore current trending options in interior design. Our whole class will attend a field trip during our last class.  We will be going to one lucky student's house, and I will give a free interior design consultation for her/his home. This course is perfect for the homeowner or for people considering getting into the interior design business. Designed for those with some basic knowledge of computers, students will learn: how to properly identify and use hardware/software, technology shortcuts, parts of the computer, proper operation of the mouse, and examination of computer storage. Windows 10 will be used in this course. Bienvenue! This course is designed to introduce students to the French language and Francophone cultures. No prior knowledge of French is required. Through a fun, interactive, and communicative approach online, you will be placed in real life situations allowing an acquisition of basic language skills that you can use on your next trip or when you meet a French person. ! A bientôt!  Special notice: This class will be delivered online. You will need access to a computer with an internet connection that remains stable for the duration of the class. Though a chat feature is available, a microphone is preferred. For most productive audio/video participation, a webcam and/or headset are encouraged. All virtual classes will be recorded. Expanding from French I-II, students will be exposed to the expression of opinions, and asking and telling the time/dates in French. This course is designed to build upon knowledge previously gained through French I and French II. The class, Introduction to French II is a prerequisite. The course is designed for students who have completed Part I through IV of the certificate program Spanish Is Fun!, as well as Beyond Spanish Is Fun, or who have intermediate-level skills in Spanish. The primary focus of this course will be on conversation of various topics and themes, including movies, news articles, current events, analysis of expressions. This class is open to the students who have a basic knowledge of the Italian language but they want to improve their ability to speak.  We will practice the fundamentals of the language, reviewing basic vocabulary and expressions.  Students will feel more confident when they will have to speak the language, each class will have a topic to talk about.  Don't be shy and jump into the conversation! This course is designed for those with a desire to learn how to sell on the internet. This class will introduce students to topics such as: how to get started, what options are available for a quick start up, proven methods for fast entrance into the world of ecommerce, and the utilization of various platforms. This course is for students who wish to take time aside to practice the simple past, present, and future tenses in Spanish. Students will engage in basic drills and short dialogues in which they will practice alternating among the tenses listed. Learn the basics of painting in oil and acrylic from a qualified, award winning professional painter.    With and emphasis on design, value and color we will explore landscape, florals, still life, and more.    We will paint directly from life or Alla Prima to gain confidence and skill. The instructor will work one on one with students to address their needs, from beginning to advanced. For oil and acrylic painters with some experience. Work on your own projects with guidance and technical assistance. The instructor will stress design, value relationships, color and emotional impact. There will also be opportunities for Alla Prima still life and Plein Air to keep your skills growing. Through a combination of Individual and group critiques you can judge the effectiveness of your work and find solutions and inspiration to move to the next level in your art. This course is designed for students who have completed Parts I through IV of the certificate program, Spanish is Fun! and Pause to Practice. The primary focus of this course will be on basic conversation, listening comprehension and writing skills related to daily life experiences. Learn the core functions and features of the Windows 10 interface, which includes how to: set up multiple desktops, organize your start screen, utilize search tools, mark up and share websites, install and use apps, view multiple email accounts in one application, and much more! This class is designed to help advanced level students further develop their extensive skills towards more completed works of art.  You should have experience painting portraits and figures, as well as knowledge and ability in the use of composition, proportions, values, colors, and edges.  You will concentrate on capturing a likeness in fresh vibrant flesh tones in oils or pastels while working from photos or live subjects.  Mr. Varner has studied with many of today’s portrait masters and uses his experience to enhance each student’s quest for personal expression. This class will review the main functionalities of the iPhone from models 6 to 12 including the SE, the MINI, the X and the XR.  Come learn what you need to know to use your iPhone without stress or concern.  The course will review the following topics:  How to determine which model you have, power and battery maintenance, volume settings, brightness, do not disturb, finger gestures, sending and receiving texts, saving pictures from texts, opening and sending email, saving pictures received in email, and sending pictures with an email. Professional artist and instructor Ernest Varner says, “If you can sign your name and I can read it, you can learn to draw and paint portraits and figures. Now that that’s out of the way, let’s have some fun!!”   This class is designed to take the mystery out of painting portraits and figures whether you prefer classical realism or impressionism. It will concentrate on capturing a likeness in fresh vibrant flesh tones in oils or pastels while working from photos. Particular attention will be given to understanding light and shadow and how to model light and shadow, with the use of more expressive drawing, value, color, edges and brushwork techniques, to create the illusion of form.   Instructor demos, slide presentations, lectures and critiques are intended to enhance students' self expression so they can take their skills to the next level. Mr. Varner has studied with many of today’s portrait masters and brings all of those skills to the classroom to add to each student’s quest for personal expression. Join us for an evening of fun, food and dancing.  *Dinner is served from 6-7 p.m. Dancing/music from 7-9 p.m. Reservations are required and can be made by calling 470-578-6765, or you can register online. The cost is $20 per person (payable at time of reservation). This secures seating for the program. Doors open at 5:45 p.m Join us for this fun and informative class with all sorts of tips, tricks, tools and “how tos” for your iPad.  You will learn how to navigate your device like a pro.  We will take you through the latest features of home screen customization, explore a few functions of the Camera and Photo apps, guide you through the App store, and share a few of our favorite tips.  Bring your own iPad or use one of ours. Medicare plans can be confusing!  Join us so that you can better plan your benefits strategy or help you guide your parents in their choices. Learn the many facets and particulars of Medicare.  Gain a foundation of Medicare Part A, B, C (Medicare Advantage) and D (Prescription Drug Plan) and Medicare Supplement plans.  Learn what factors to include in choosing the right plan.  We discuss Pros and Cons of growing trend of working past age 65 at your employer but leaving employer benefits plan to enroll in Medicare plan to save money on premiums. Get the full advantage of this neat gadget!  We cover all the following in this quick 3-hour class:  	Setup – connection to phone 	Review of controls within the phone for the watch 	Review of buttons/dials on watch 	Common uses – answer call, receive a text, ping my phone 	Fancier Features - Check my heart rate, emergency contacts Learn secrets your piano teacher never told you in this 3-hour session. Students will learn all the chords needed to play any song, any style, and any key. Students will then perfect their technique at home using the student manual issued during class. A cash or check payment of $29 is required for the student manual and supplies. In this course, the fourth in a series, students will learn about the famous and not-so-famous events and personalities of the Civil War in Georgia.  Recommend Text: Day by Day Through the Civil War in Georgia, by Michael K. Shaffer. (ISBN: 9780881468243.) Are you in your 2nd marriage? Join us as we navigate through thoughtful considerations on how to design your estate plan. Do you have children from prior marriages? You will not want to miss this class as we show you how to benefit your spouse without accidentally disinheriting your children. Instructors will give you thoughtful information to help you gain insight on how to avoid today's biggest estate planning mistakes. This is a fun, basic, hands-on class. Students will use software involving the basics of Microsoft Word. Learn the fundamentals of navigation and selection techniques used in email, and on the Internet. This class uses Microsoft Word 2016 to create, edit, save and print a letter format. Prerequisite: Introduction to PCs. This hands-on interior decorating course will focus on taking you beyond the basics.  Teaching the latest trends in interior design. You will learn where and how to shop, and how to avoid costly mistakes. With an educational step-by-step plan for your home, you will also learn many kitchen design concepts or media room tips, or accessorizing with the perfect final touches, your spaces will become a beautiful place to welcome you home. Whether creating a relaxing outdoor living space, developing a home theater, or giving you fresh ideas for a kitchen makeover, this course will provide you with the tools and apps to help you succeed.   We’ll take a field trip to D.M. Interiors & Design to learn how to choose and coordinate color palettes of fabric, wallpaper, paint colors, and art that will be aesthetically pleasing as well as functional. You will learn how to create a detailed storyboard for your home. The final class will be a site visit to one lucky student’s home in which the class separates into groups as your group will share decorating tips and ideas with the lucky homeowner. Celebrate the season by joining us in our Gingerbread Baking class!  Learn the techniques of rolling, cutting, and baking your own gingerbread house.  Discover how to “glue” your pieces together using royal icing to assemble and decorate your gingerbread house to take home.  We will also explore traditional gingerbread recipes Participants enrolled in this seminar will learn all about eBay. This includes: an introduction to eBay, eBay safety, a synopsis of opportunities available on eBay, setting up a secure seller's account, pricing strategies, putting together a complete listing, and completing the sale. Continue your journey in learning la bella lingua". If you have already taken the previous classes or if you have already been exposed to the italian language, this is the class for you. Be ready to speak more in Italian and to deepen your knowledge. we will continue talking about the culture and traditions of Italy in a fun way. Ci vediamo!" Are you planning your next travel adventure to Italy? Get a head start on the basic communication skills to get the most out of your trip!  Pronunciation, typical greetings, and travel-related dialogue will be covered in a fun learning environment. Enjoy your discovery of cultural observances, while you learn to speak simple phrases in Italian. The Osher Lifelong Learning Institute (OLLI) offers an impressive selection of educational and social opportunities for adults age 50 and older. With a purpose to promote lifelong learning and continued intellectual and personal growth for retirement-age individuals, OLLI has become the place for fun, interactive learning in a safe and encouraging environment. Curriculum draws from the interests, talents, and experiences of older adult learners. Academic courses are college-level (without the homework, term papers, and tests), and cover everything from personal computers to fitness for life and visual arts. Social activities include various gatherings for dinner, laughter, entertainment, and travel. Click here to view the printed version of the latest OLLI catalog. Learn more about our Scholarships and Financial Aid In March 2005, Chet Austin established the Al and Chet Education Fund with a generous contribution to support the Osher Lifelong Learning Institute at The College of Professional Education at Kennesaw State University. We offer a variety of options for financing your professional education. Select each section to expand it for more information. For Financial Aid questions or information, contact our registration office at 470-578-6765 or  cereg@kennesaw.edu . Check out the latest updates for OLLI Want to learn more about our travel program, sign up for an OLLI Club Room Membership, enroll in our literacy program or just have a question? Fill out the form below and we’ll be in touch!  The Osher Lifelong Learning Institute (OLLI) offers an impressive selection of educational and social opportunities for adults age 50 and older. title: Pre-Health Advising - College of Science and Mathematics
body:
College of Science and Mathematics Resources For The Pre-Health Advisor is an additional resource for students in any major at KSU
                     who are interested in pursuing a career in a professional health field. Your major
                     advisor will remain your primary advisor. The Pre-Health Advisor will assist you with... To receive important information about Pre-Health, please complete the form below
                              to connect you to the Pre-Health Advisor. Look for additional communication from Tabitha
                              in August!   Senior Academic Advisor for Pre-Health Location:  Science Building, Room #204   Explore Health Professions   Physicians support and manage the health care of people of all ages. They take medical
                              histories, perform physical examinations, conduct diagnostic tests, recommend, and
                              provide treatment, conduct research, and advise patients on their overall health and
                              well-being. While there are many different types of physicians, they can usually be
                              divided into three broad categories: primary care physicians, surgeons, and specialists. There are two types of fully licensed physicians that can practice anywhere in the
                              U.S. One is an M.D. (Doctor of Medicine) and the other is a D.O. (Doctor of Osteopathic
                              Medicine). Professional Organizations: Veterinarians provide medical care for domestic animals, livestock, working animals,
                              wildlife, exotic, zoo, and aquatic animals. Every community needs veterinary professionals
                              to provide animal health care, but veterinarians also do many other kinds of jobs.
                              They make sure the nation’s food supply is safe. They work to control the spread of
                              diseases. They conduct research that helps both animals and humans. Veterinarians
                              are at the forefront of protecting the public’s health and welfare. Professional Organizations: Dentists evaluate the overall health of their patients while advising them about oral
                              health and disease prevention. They also perform clinical procedures, such as exams,
                              fillings, crowns, implants, extractions, and corrective surgeries. They identify,
                              diagnose, and treat oral conditions. Dentists perform general dentistry or practice
                              one of many specialties. There are two types of fully licensed dentists. One is a D.D.S. (Doctor of Dental
                              Surgery) and the other is a D.M.D (Doctor of Dental Medicine). Professional Organizations: Optometrists are the primary care doctors of the eye and the frontline protectors
                              of vision. As primary-care providers, optometrists are educated in general health
                              and systemic disease. They are often the first to detect critical health issues from
                              diabetes, hypertension, stroke, or cancer and refer patients for additional treatment.
                              Optometrists have the specialized knowledge to manage eye health and have a positive
                              impact on patients’ overall health. Professional Organizations: Podiatrists, also known as podiatric physicians or surgeons, are qualified by their
                              education and training to diagnose and treat conditions affecting the foot, ankle,
                              and related structures of the leg. Podiatrists are uniquely qualified among medical
                              professionals to treat the lower extremity based on their education, training, and
                              expertise. Within the profession, podiatrists can specialize in a variety of areas
                              such as surgery, orthopedics, or public health. Besides these certified specialties,
                              podiatrists may practice a subspecialty such as sports medicine, pediatrics, dermatology,
                              radiology, geriatrics, or diabetic foot care. Professional Organizations: Pharmacists are medication experts who enhance patient care and promote wellness.
                              Pharmacists use their professional knowledge to prepare and dispense prescriptions,
                              ensure medicines and doses are correct, prevent harmful drug interactions, and counsel
                              patients on the safe and appropriate use of their medications. Pharmacists have unique
                              and specialized expertise about the composition of medicines, including chemical,
                              biological, and physical properties, as well as manufacturing and use. Professional Organizations: Physician Assistants are medical providers who are licensed to diagnose and treat
                              illnesses and diseases, as well as prescribe medication. Physician Assistants work
                              in hospitals and clinics in collaboration with a licensed physician. Professional Organizations: Anesthesiologist Assistants are highly skilled medical professionals who help plan
                              and deliver anesthesia care within the Anesthesia Care Team. Anesthesiologist Assistants
                              work as physician extenders who deliver a variety of care techniques under the supervision
                              of an anesthesiologist. Their responsibilities include establishing patient monitoring
                              devices and intravenous access, assisting in the induction, maintenance, and emergence
                              of a patient's anesthetic, interpreting, and recording the patient's physiological
                              and pharmacological status, and providing continuity of care into and during the post-operative
                              period. Professional Organizations: Pathologists’ Assistants are highly trained, certified allied healthcare professionals
                              who are qualified by academic and practical training to provide various services in
                              anatomic pathology under the direction and supervision of a licensed, Board-Certified
                              Anatomic Pathologist. Pathologists’ Assistants are academically and practically trained
                              to provide accurate and timely processing of a variety of laboratory specimens, including
                              comprehensive macroscopic examination and evaluation of all surgical pathological
                              specimens. Pathologists’ Assistants play a critical role in the delivery of healthcare
                              services in both surgical pathology and autopsy pathology. Professional Organizations: Physical Therapists diagnose and treat individuals of all ages, from newborns to people
                                 at the end of life. They examine each patient and develop a treatment plan to improve
                                 mobility, reduce or manage pain, restore function, and prevent disability. Physical
                                 Therapists help people achieve fitness goals, regain or maintain their independence,
                                 and lead active lives. Professional Organizations: Occupational Therapists enable people of all ages to live life to the fullest by helping
                              them promote health, and prevent—or live better with—injury, illness, or disability.
                              Occupational Therapists work in a variety of settings. They help children with disabilities
                              participate fully in school and social situations, assist people recovering from injury
                              to regain skills, and provide support for older adults experiencing physical and cognitive
                              changes. Occupational Therapists have a holistic perspective. They focus on adapting
                              the environment and/or task to fit the person, and the person is an integral part
                              of the therapy team and process. Professional Organizations:   Contact Info Kennesaw Campus 1000 Chastain Road Kennesaw, GA 30144 Marietta Campus 1100 South Marietta Pkwy Marietta, GA 30060 Campus Maps Phone 470-KSU-INFO (470-578-4636) kennesaw.edu/info Media Resources Resources For Related Links Follow KSU 470-KSU-INFO  (470-578-4636) ©  2022 Kennesaw State University. All Rights Reserved.

title: Course Information - College of Science and Mathematics
body:
College of Science and Mathematics Resources For To ensure that course override information is fair and consistent for students, the
                     College of Science and Mathematics (CSM) has created universal policies across departments
                     for the handling of three types of overrides. Please note that transient and non-degree
                     seeking students must also ensure that they are meeting CSM's procedure on courses
                     and access. The policies are listed below:
                   Due to the nature of the courses in CSM, we want to give students the highest possibility
                              of success in our courses.  Because of this, courses in CSM have a "No prereq override"
                              policy.  A student must meet the prerequisite for a course that they intend to take.
                            If you have taken the prerequisite at another institution, please email an advisor
                              to request a prerequisite override. We will need to see proof that you have or are
                              currently completing the prerequisite elsewhere.
                            You're getting a prereq error for the lab from waitlist : If you have received a notification from the waitlist that a lab seat is available
                              to you, BUT you have not gotten into the lecture yet, you do not meet the requirement
                              to register for the lab.  You will need to get into a lecture seat before grabbing
                              your lab seat from the waitlist.  This is not something that we can fix because we
                              cannot affirm that you have gotten into your lecture seat to keep the override in
                              place.
                            Registering or swapping courses that are corequisites .  Please click here for information on registering for corequisites.
                            I am a Transient or Non-Degree Student needing to take a course in this college . Please email csmadvising@kennesaw.edu when you have received acceptance to KSU and
                              share the courses that you are interested in taking for instructions on your next
                              steps (MATH, CHEM, BIOL, PHYS, SCI, STAT, and ENVS courses are housed in this college).
                              Include your KSU ID# in that email to assist with looking into your account.
                            We recognize that certain courses are extremely popular in our college. We are constantly
                              trying to meet demand for our courses. But, this sometimes still means that a class
                              you wish to take fills up. To best utilize the systems available at KSU (wait-lists),
                              CSM has a "No closed class override" policy. We want all students to have an equal
                              chance at getting into a class.
                            Please review KSU wait-listing information  here .
                            If you think a transfer credit ("T") could be a substitution for a KSU course, then
                     get your course description and/or a course syllabus from the other school, then email
                     the appropriate advisor, your KSU ID #, major, course request, course syllabus (or
                     course description if only justification available) from the other school. NOTE: Very
                     few STAT courses can be substituted from transfer credit outside of KSU.
                   Academic program maps offer suggested four-year schedules of courses for all of KSU's
                     degree programs based on requirements in the official KSU catalog. Each map provides
                     a sample schedule each term, including milestones, keeping you on track for timely
                     progress to graduation! title: CSM New Students - College of Science and Mathematics
body:
College of Science and Mathematics Resources For Welcome to the College of Science and Mathematics (CSM)! We are looking forward to
                     having you join our CSM community! To best assist new students with their orientation
                     and registration experience, please click below for step by step instructions!
                   Been accepted and don't know what to do yet? Check below! FIRST YEAR STUDENTS Start by signing up! You will register for your classes during your orientation date,
                              so we'd highly encourage choosing the earliest date available to you.
                            For more information and the sign-up procedure, click here! If we know you're going to be completing a major in CSM, we are going to be reaching
                              out to students via orientation rosters before orientation.  But, you don't have to
                              wait for us to reach out to you!  Please go ahead and schedule an appointment with
                              your advisor!  We're currently advising virtually, so click  here   for steps to setting up a virtual appointment!
                            You'll also notice on that page that your advisor point of contact information is
                              listed.
                            Your starting place for math might change what science courses you have available
                              to you during your first semester at KSU.  All majors in CSM require  at least  up to MATH 1190 Calculus I in the degree requirements.
                            Your High School information dictates your potential starting place. MATH 1111 College Algebra:  Anyone can start here, but you might be able to start higher! MATH 1113 Precalculus:  You can start here if you have a SAT MATH score of 570 or above (ACT MATH 23 or above)
                              AND a high school GPA of 2.8 or above MATH 1190 Calculus I:  You can start here if you have a SAT MATH score of 620 or above (ACT MATH 26 or above)
                              AND a high school GPA of 3.2 or above
                            Not happy with your Math placement based on HS information?  Take  ALEKS !
                            **Please email your academic advisor if you have questions about ALEKS or need to
                              get the ALEKS code**
                            TRANSFER STUDENTS Start by signing up! You will register for your classes during your orientation date,
                              so we'd highly encourage choosing the earliest date available to you.
                            For more information and the sign-up procedure, click here! Visit our  transfer advising page  for more information on how we work to support transfer students!
                            We know that the transfer process can be overwhelming, but we want to make it as simple,
                              as possible! Please follow the steps on our Transfer Advising page to help with your
                              initial contacts with CSM Advising.
                            ORIENTATION DAY PROCEDURES Most of the orientation days will come with a morning session where you will get to
                              hear straight from the Advising Office!  We will share information about classes you
                              should be trying to register for, show you a little of the registration software process,
                              and share tips for success when coming to KSU!
                            After this session occurs, spend some time preparing for the actual registration process. 
                              It is up to the student to register themselves for their courses (unfortunately, we
                              cannot place students into courses).  You will find a section below called "Help Guides"
                              with registration support guides.
                            You might be coming to this page because you just heard about it in the morning advising
                              portion of your orientation day!
                            Please  email  your orientation day advisor before you register from your KSU email with:
                            Help Guides and Information Before You Start at KSU! 1) If you are unsure about your schedule still, set up an  Appointment  to chat with your advisor.
                            2) Check your schedule on Owl Express. Check the Registration tab! And, be aware of
                              the "Select Term" button at the top so that you can move between semesters!
                            3) Check where your classes are on a  KSU Map .
                            a) For Fall, do you have classes on both campuses? If traveling between campuses on
                              the same day, we suggest at least an hour and a half between classes for all of the
                              little things that can happen when traveling (traffic, parking, etc). *If your classes
                              are on the same campus, it is fine to go with the 15 minutes between classes.*
                            4) Are you part-time or full-time? Part-time is defined as 6 credit hours.  Full-time
                              is defined as at least 12.
                            5) When do classes start and what's the semester schedule? Check the  calendars  here!
                            4) Check out some of KSU's resources for students at the bottom of this page! Check out some of these other resources at KSU! title: Facilities & Leased Space – Community and Professional Education
body: KSU Center at Kennesaw State University is uniquely designed to accommodate educationally-oriented events in a state-of-the-art meeting and training environment. To have someone contact you regarding room availability, pricing, and services, please call 470-578-6912. KSU Center is located just off exit 271 on Interstate 75, and two miles west of Interstate 575 at exit 3 in  Kennesaw, Georgia , only one mile from the main campus of Kennesaw State University. KSU Center offers conference rooms, function rooms, classrooms, and computer labs to satisfy your meeting needs. Parking is free.   Rooms are furnished with comfortable tables and chairs, easels, white boards, ceiling-mounted projectors with wide-ratio projection screens and wall-mounted controls, high speed internet connections, and built-in projection systems. The conference rooms offer built-in sound systems, and wireless connectivity is available throughout the building. KSU Center provides a professional, educational environment designed to satisfy your meeting and training needs. KSU Center offers nine computer labs with a total of 195 student computer stations. Each lab is equipped with an instructor station as well. The minimum level PC is an Intel Core i5 660 CPU @ 3.33GHz, 8 GB RAM, Windows 7 64-bit OS. The maximum level is an Intel Core i7-6700T CPU @ 2.80GHz, 16 GB RAM, Windows 10 64-bit OS. Our minimum-sized lab has 14 student stations and the maximum-sized has 35. Each lab is also equipped with a ceiling-mounted projector with wall-mounted controls.   We have numerous classroom spaces that in total can be arranged in various configurations for your meeting and training needs. The size of these classrooms vary, with some conducive to seating groups of 10 or less, while others comfortably seat up to 50. Each classroom is equipped with ceiling-mounted projectors, projection screens, wall-mounted controls and an instructor PC that is wired to the projection system. Access to the university wireless system is openly and freely available. Whiteboards and flipcharts are also available.   We have a large classroom/conference room meeting space that is typically set for 100 but provides a maximum capacity of 132. This room is equipped with a ceiling-mounted projector, projection screen, wall-mounted controls, and an instructor PC wired to the projection system. Access to the university wireless system is openly and freely available. Wireless microphones, a document camera, and portable whiteboards are also provided. The function room is a large multi-purpose meeting space designed to accommodate up to 240 banquet style or 375 theater style and can be set with a riser stage and podium. In addition, an adjacent catering buffet area and restrooms makes for a convenient setting. The room is equipped with two ceiling-mounted projectors, two large screens, wall-mounted controls and cabling for connecting a laptop to the projection system. Wireless microphones and free and open access to the campus wireless network is also provided.   Kennesaw - KSU Center (470) 578-6765  © 2022 Kennesaw State University - Community and Professional Education

title: Career Development Resources – Community and Professional Education
body: Career Advising at KSU Professional Education is designed to provide  students  with the most current local data on wages, industry growth, job postings, and associated  skills, education and training.   We offer complimentary career advising sessions to prospective, current and past students as an opportunity to discuss advancement opportunities within your current field or careers pathways that may align well with your interests, goals and skills, including what short and long-term plans might look like for working toward your personal and professional goals.     S2S  is offered through our partnership with Accen ture and is designed to help individuals build the skills and confidence they need to make smart career choices and find and succeed in employment.  The program consists of dozens of interactive modules on topics including Career Exploration, Resume and Cover Letter Writing, Professional Online Presence, Interviewing Skills and skills to help you succeed at the workplace.     Handshake is an all-in-one career management system for our alumni which includes a job board, document/resource library and communication system. Alumni can search and apply for jobs in Handshake and will have their resumes reviewed by a staff member.   All CPE students who successfully complete a certificate program are eligible to request a Handshake account.     We recently held two webinars to help guide you in kickstarting your career!     Facebook Job Board at KSU’s College of Professional Education is an interactive networking space where current students and alumni can connect with employers and even share job listings with one another Join us TODAY to explore our current listing Potential Employers   Please click on this  link  and follow the instructions to post open positions with your company. Thank you for your interest in our students!              KSU Employee Appreciation Week   Interview Stream  is a software program that enables individuals to build skills that employers are looking for through mock interviews online.  The program helps students gain knowledge and confidence in their interview skills by working on perfecting their pitch and practicing essential soft skills that employers are looking for during the interview process.         The Department of Career Planning and Development at KSU hosts multiple in-person and online job career fairs, interview preparation workshops and events to help you succeed.  You may also check our Career Events calendar through Handshake to stay  up-to-date  on the latest events and career opportunities.     – Career Development Newsletter _ January 2022   Download – Career Development Newsletter _ February 2022    Download – Career Development Newsletter _ March & April 2022   Download   April 2022 March 2022 February 2022 January 2022 Kennesaw - KSU Center (470) 578-6765  © 2022 Kennesaw State University - Community and Professional Education

title: Catalog – Community and Professional Education
body: Would you like to request a catalog by  mail  or  e-mail ? Pack your bags and let’s start planning. As I promised in my last note, we are ready to travel. We are heading to Italy! As many of you know, we had to cancel our previous Italy trip due to COVID-19 but now, borders are open and we can once again, start planning to tour Rome, Florence, Siena and Montepulciano, Italy. Montepulciano is Kennesaw State University’s first permanent international education site, and it is located in a beautiful Renaissance town. It is known as the largest hill town in southern Tuscany, and we are happy to include this magnificent part of Italy to our travel trip. The trip will be led by Ken Hill, who is a KSU faculty member that lives in Montepulciano. He knows the ends and outs of Italy and will make sure that we do not miss any of the must-see areas of Italy but will also make sure that we see those special places only known to by the locals. Plan to join us for one of the two Information Sessions about this trip. The first session is scheduled for Wednesday, September 29th at 10:00am and the second on Wednesday, November 17th at 5:00pm.. Ken Hill will be joining us remotely for the first information session and has promised to let us peak outside his windows and see the beautiful surroundings of the city. Italy is on the top of my bucket list and I am counting the days until we embark on this adventure. If you love to travel as I do, we have all been waiting to be able to plan an international trip like this again. I am not stopping with this trip. I am already in the process of planning a second OLLI trip that we can all begin to enjoy together. One of the best things about traveling with OLLI is so many people travel alone, and this provides us with an opportunity to make new friends that share our same interests. Mark your calendars for one of the information sessions and we will review the itinerary, cost, trip dates and all the details. I will also ask your input about what other destinations that you would like to see us offer. Reservations are not required for these information sessions. Don’t forget to review the catalog for new classes and a return of your favorites. You may notice that the Personal classes and the OLLI classes are not divided in the catalog. We felt it was easier to combine the classes and allow everyone to participate. Feel free to register for any of the classes that you see here in the catalog. You may also view the classes on the website at cpe. kennesaw.edu. Each person that is 50 years of age or older is eligible for two scholarships per fiscal year. You will find the scholarship information on the website too. I look forward to seeing you soon and I am always available for questions or suggestions.   Pat Walker Program Manager, Osher Lifelong Learning Institute (OLLI)   Kennesaw - KSU Center (470) 578-6765  © 2022 Kennesaw State University - Community and Professional Education

title: Financial Aid – Community and Professional Education
body: We offer a variety of options for financing your professional education. Select each section to expand it for more information. Refer-A-Friend Discount  (only eligible for specific CPE Executive Education programs) The 20% Refer a Friend discount is valid for the CPE Executive Education programs. Cannot be combined with any other discount but may be applied to more than one course. The discount will be applied at the time of registration and requires that you refer a friend (or colleague) who will also register for one of the eligible programs. The discount can be applied to the following CPE Executive  Education programs: Executive Leadership Program for Managers and Directors, Certified Mergers & Acquisitions Professional (CMAP) Program, Executive Certificate in Business Strategy: The Coles Mini MBA Program,  and the  Accelerate Management Program for Early-Career and Mid-Career Professionals.   Discount can be applied when registering online, by calling 470-578-6765, or stopping by the Registration office. CPE Alumni Discount  (must have successfully completed a CPE certificate program) 10% discount on certificate programs owned by CPE. Discount can only be applied to the graduate and is not transferable to family members. There is no limit to the number of classes a CPE alumni may take. Third-party online classes are eligible for a 10% discount with a maximum discount of $400. KSU/SPSU Alumni Discount  (must be a graduate of KSU main campus or Marietta campus) 10% discount on certificate programs owned by CPE, with a maximum discount of $500. Discount can only be applied to the graduate and is not transferable to family members. There is no limit to the number of classes a KSU/SPSU alumni may take. Third-party online classes are eligible for a 10% discount with a maximum discount of $400, and excludes Real Estate courses. KSU Student Discount  (must have been enrolled on campus within last year) 25% discount on certificate programs owned by CPE. Discount can only be applied to the student and is not transferable to family members. There is no limit to the number of classes a KSU student may take. Third-party online classes are eligible for a 10% discount with a maximum discount of $400, and excludes Real Estate courses. Click   here   for  CPE Partner Organizations . Employer educational or tuition vouchers can be used to pay for enrollment. The voucher must clearly state the student’s name, the employer’s name and address, the class(es) to enroll the student in, and the total amount approved. Course enrollment will be made once the voucher is received. ThThe College of Professional Education to KSU Community and Professional Education will then invoice the employer for payment. The College of Professional Education to KSU Community and Professional Education does not accept vouchers with restrictions, such as “will not pay until course is over” or “must make a C or better.” To access additional information about vouchers, purchase orders and invoicing, visit our  FAQs   for specific instructions. Amazon Employees: Career Choice Program Employees may use funds from Amazon’s Career Choice Program to pay for professional education courses. All professional education courses are eligible under this program. AmeriCorps Educational Vouchers Students may use AmeriCorps Educational Vouchers/Segal AmeriCorps Education Awards to pay for courses. All courses are eligible under this voucher/award system. Verizon Wireless Employees: Letter of Credit Vouchers Employees may use Verizon Wireless Letter of Credit Vouchers to pay for courses. All courses are eligible under this voucher system. There are financial institutions that provide loan options to students needing educational financial assistance. Loans may include tuition, and in some cases, lenders may allow students to borrow additional funds to cover the cost of tuition plus expenses such as books, supplies, and transportation. Loan applicants may be required to have a co-signer, and the loan interest rate will vary according to an applicant’s credit rating. Current Professional Education Loan Providers: Commerce Bank Loans Commerce Bank offers two types of loans: Your Future Education Loan   – Private Student Loan Their Future Education Loan  – Private Parent (or any creditworthy borrower other than the student) When applying, applicants should indicate the following: For loan assistance, contact Commerce Bank at 1-855-342-2006. For Registration, call 470-578-6765 or email  cefinancialaid@kennesaw.edu Sallie Mae Sallie Mae offers an online application for the  Sallie Mae Smart Option Student Loan, click here. When applying, applicants should indicate the following: For loan assistance, contact Sallie Mae at 1-877-279-7172. For Registration, call 470-578-6765 or email  cefinancialaid@kennesaw.edu . Active duty and honorably discharged members of the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, and National Guard may qualify for military education benefits. These benefits may provide reimbursement for certificate programs, based upon  GI   Bill ® coverage and length of service. Additionally, military spouses interested in pursuing continuing and professional education are eligible for up to $4,000 through MyCAA. Details of  Military Educational Benefits . GI   Bill ® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). More information about education benefits offered by VA is available at the official U.S. government Web site at  https://www.benefits.va.gov/ gi bill. The College of Professional Education is proud to offer payment plans for most certificate programs. Please read the  payment plan details here . For more information about payment plan options, please call 470-578-6765 or email  cefinancialaid@kennesaw.edu . We offer two types of scholarships: More information  about scholarships . The Workforce Innovation & Opportunity Act is a federal grant that covers training expenses for dislocated workers and economically disadvantaged individuals. To apply for the WIOA grant, contact the WIOA Office for the county in which you reside, or the county where you worked when you were laid off from employment. The web addresses for the WIOA County Offices are below. If your county is not listed or you would like to find the address of the nearest WIOA Office, please visit the  Metro Atlanta eXchange for Workforce Solutions website . The WIOA application process takes several weeks, so please do not delay in getting started. Once WIOA grant approval is awarded by the WIOA Office, contact our Registration office at  cefinancial@kennesaw.edu  for a Letter of Acceptance, or by calling 470-578-6765. Certificate programs and bundles approved for WIOA funding include the following: AutoCAD Trio (AutoCAD Essentials, AutoCAD Intermediate, AutoCAD Advanced) Bookkeeper Professional Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) Cisco CCNA EKG Technician EKG/Phlebotomy Technician (EKG Technician, Phlebotomy Technician) Healthcare Technician (Certified Nursing Assistant, EKG Technician, Phlebotomy Technician) Human Resources Management SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP Information Systems Security Professional Medical Assisting Medical Coding Specialist Medical Interpreter Medical Office Assistant (MOA) Medical Office Assistant/Medical Coding (Medical Office Assistant, Medical Coding Specialist) Paralegal Payroll Fundamentals Payroll Mastery Payroll Professional (Payroll Fundamentals, Payroll Mastery) Pharmacy Technician Phlebotomy Technician Project Management Project Management Certificate – Online Revit Architecture Certificate For Financial Aid Questions or information, contact our Financial Aid specialist at 470-578-6765 or  cefinancialaid@kennesaw.edu . title: Student Success - College of Science and Mathematics
body:
College of Science and Mathematics Resources For 
                      The College of Science and Mathematics (CSM) is committed to student success . The CSM faculty, staff, and administrators believe that students deserve the best
                     education that we can provide. We work together to ensure that students develop meaningful
                     and relevant knowledge and skills for their chosen field(s) of study. We adapt our
                     instructional practices and pedagogical approaches to meet the changing needs of students
                     and those of society. We seek out feedback from key stakeholders across the campus
                     community and in the workforce to ensure that not only are we meeting students' current
                     needs, we are also positioning them to be competitive upon graduation from Kennesaw
                     State University (KSU). Student success is our success. CSM promotes student success through the following: We use data to guide and inform our efforts and to examine their impact on student
                     learning and success.
